VI Analyzer - Select Task Dialog Box

Requires: Base Development System

Note  The VI Analyzer functionality this topic describes is available only if you install and activate the LabVIEW VI Analyzer Toolkit or if the LabVIEW Data\VI Analyzer Tests directory contains tests.

Select Tools»VI Analyzer»Analyze VIs to display this dialog box.

Use this dialog box to select the type of task you want the VI Analyzer to perform.

This dialog box includes the following options:

  • Start a new VI Analyzer task—Displays dialog boxes you can use to select the VIs you want to analyze and the tests you want to run.
  • Load a previously saved analysis configuration file—Displays a file dialog that allows you to select a configuration file to use.
  • Analyze the current VI—Displays dialog boxes you can use to create a VI Analyzer task for the VI from which you launched the VI Analyzer. This option is available only if you run the VI Analyzer from an open VI that you have saved.
    • VI Name—Displays the name of the VI to be analyzed.
  • Analyze the current project—Displays dialog boxes you can use to create a VI Analyzer task for the VIs in the active project. This option is available only if you run the VI Analyzer from the Project Explorer window.
    • Project Name—Displays the name of the project to analyze.
    • Target—Specifies the target in the current project that includes the VIs you want to analyze.
